definitions: way of standing or positioning the body
particular attitude or opinion about an issue or situation
examples: He adopted a defensive stance during the boxing match
The dancer's stance was perfectly balanced and graceful
The company took a firm stance against workplace discrimination
Her political stance has shifted considerably over the years

definitions: small furry animal with long ears and powerful hind legs
examples: The rabbit hopped quickly across the garden path
Wild rabbits often damage vegetable gardens in spring

definitions: brief interruption or break in activity or speech
examples: She took a pause before answering the difficult question
The music had several dramatic pauses for effect

definitions: small round mark or spot used in writing or design
very small amount or speck of something
examples: Place a dot above each letter i in your writing
The map showed our location with a red dot
Add just a dot of cream to the coffee
There wasn't a dot of evidence against him

definitions: person who gives money, help, or ideas to something
examples: She was a regular contributor to the local newspaper
The museum recognized its major contributors with a plaque

definitions: flat circular plate or similar round flat object
device for storing computer data magnetically or optically
examples: The ancient artifact was shaped like a flat disk
He threw the disk across the field with skill
Save your work to the hard disk before shutting down
The computer's disk drive started making unusual noises

definitions: chance or probability that something will happen or be true
examples: There's a strong likelihood of rain this afternoon
The likelihood of success increases with better preparation

definitions: person who shares one or both parents with another
examples: She has three siblings, two brothers and a sister
Sibling rivalry is common in many families with children

definitions: direction or area between south and east on a compass
examples: The storm is moving in from the southeast tonight
They live in the southeast corner of the city

definitions: person who creates art using paint as a medium
person whose job is painting buildings or rooms
examples: The painter captured the sunset beautifully on canvas
Monet was a famous French impressionist painter
We hired a painter to refresh our living room walls
The painter carefully taped the windows before starting work

definitions: person or thing that corresponds to another in position or function
examples: The minister met with her Canadian counterpart yesterday
This software is the desktop counterpart to our mobile app

definitions: person who has religious faith or believes in something strongly
examples: She's a firm believer in the power of positive thinking
The church welcomed new believers into their congregation

definitions: device that produces light using electricity, oil, or gas
examples: She turned on the bedside lamp to read her book
The street lamps flickered on as darkness fell

definitions: person confined to a prison or similar institution
examples: The prison holds over two thousand inmates currently
Inmates are allowed visitors twice a week

definitions: very small amount or barely noticeable sign of something
line or mark made by drawing or copying something
examples: Scientists found traces of ancient life in the rocks
There wasn't a trace of anger in her voice
The architect traced the building plans onto fresh paper
Children love to trace pictures from their coloring books

definitions: device that removes unwanted substances from liquids or gases
process or system for selecting or excluding certain things
examples: Change your car's air filter every twelve thousand miles
The water filter removes chlorine and other impurities
The email filter blocked most of the spam messages
They use strict filters when screening job applications

definitions: soft cushion used to support the head during sleep
examples: She fluffed her pillow before going to bed
The hotel provided extra pillows for guest comfort

definitions: curved path of a celestial object around another body
examples: Earth completes one orbit around the sun each year
The satellite was placed into a low Earth orbit

definitions: small bag used by women to carry personal items
small pouch or wallet for carrying money
examples: She searched through her purse for the car keys
The leather purse matched her shoes perfectly
The winner's purse for the tournament was fifty thousand dollars
He kept coins in a small purse on his belt

definitions: food given to animals or babies regularly
continuous supply of information or content from a source
examples: Buy chicken feed at the farm supply store
The baby needs another feed in two hours
Check your social media feed for the latest updates
The news feed refreshes automatically every few minutes

definitions: group of words containing a subject and predicate in grammar
particular section or provision in a legal document
examples: This sentence contains both main and subordinate clauses
The dependent clause cannot stand alone as a sentence
Read the fine print clauses before signing the contract
The escape clause allows either party to terminate early

definitions: side opposite to right when facing forward
what remains after other parts are taken or used
examples: Turn left at the next traffic light
He writes with his left hand naturally
Save what's left of the cake for tomorrow
Only three tickets were left when we arrived

definitions: small area of still water smaller than a lake
examples: Ducks were swimming peacefully in the garden pond
The farm pond provides water for the livestock

definitions: broad piece of armor carried for protection in battle
anything that protects or defends against harm or danger
examples: Medieval knights carried shields into battle for protection
The warrior's shield bore his family crest
Sunscreen acts as a shield against harmful UV rays
The trees provided a natural shield from the wind

definitions: quality of being liked or supported by many people
examples: The band's popularity soared after their hit single
Social media can quickly boost a product's popularity

definitions: television show or movie using animation techniques
simple drawing intended to be funny or make a point
examples: Children watched cartoons every Saturday morning
The new cartoon features talking animals on adventures
The editorial cartoon mocked the politician's recent statement
He drew cartoons for the school newspaper

definitions: collection of objects shown publicly in a museum or gallery
object or document presented as evidence in court
examples: The museum's new exhibit features ancient Egyptian artifacts
Thousands visited the photography exhibit last month
The lawyer presented the knife as exhibit A
Each exhibit was carefully labeled and documented

definitions: fixed basin with water supply and drain for washing
act of going down below the surface or to a lower level
examples: Wash the dishes in the kitchen sink please
The bathroom sink was clogged with hair
We watched the sun sink below the horizon
The ship began to sink after hitting the iceberg

definitions: visual design element used in media or computing
extremely clear and detailed description often of something unpleasant
examples: The presentation included colorful graphics and charts
Computer graphics have revolutionized movie special effects
The witness gave a graphic account of the accident
The novel contains graphic scenes of violence

definitions: person who is dearly loved or favored by someone
examples: She called her husband darling after twenty years together
The child was the darling of the entire family

definitions: person or company that sells goods or services
examples: Street vendors sold fresh fruit at the market
We need to find a reliable software vendor

definitions: meeting or coming together of people for a purpose
examples: The family gathering included relatives from three states
A large gathering formed outside the courthouse

definitions: abnormally high body temperature caused by illness
state of nervous excitement or intense enthusiasm
examples: The child's fever broke after taking the medicine
Call the doctor if the fever exceeds one hundred degrees
World Cup fever swept through the entire nation
Gold fever drove thousands to California in 1849

definitions: thin shaft with a point shot from a bow
symbol shaped like an arrow used to indicate direction
examples: The archer's arrow hit the center of the target
Native Americans crafted arrows with stone tips
Follow the arrows to find the emergency exit
Click the down arrow to see more options

definitions: economic system based on private ownership of business and profit
examples: Capitalism encourages competition between businesses
Many countries adopted capitalism after the Cold War

definitions: forceful strike or blow made with the foot
feeling of excitement or stimulation from an experience
examples: The soccer player's kick sent the ball flying
The horse gave a powerful kick with its hind legs
She gets a kick out of solving puzzles
Skydiving gave him the biggest kick of his life

definitions: utensil with prongs used for eating or serving food
point where something divides into two or more branches
examples: Use your fork to eat the salad properly
The silver fork belonged to her grandmother's set
Take the left fork when the road splits ahead
The river forms a fork near the old bridge

definitions: time between one event and another happening later
examples: The store reopens Monday; in the meantime, shop online
She studied French and in the meantime improved her Spanish

definitions: period of remaining in a place as a guest or visitor
examples: Their stay at the resort lasted two wonderful weeks
The hospital stay was shorter than originally expected

definitions: something that seems real but does not actually exist
examples: The magician created an illusion of floating in air
Success without hard work is just an illusion

definitions: process of taking something away from its place or position
examples: The furniture removal company arrived early Monday morning
Stain removal requires the right cleaning products

definitions: member of a Semitic people originally from the Arabian peninsula
examples: Many Arabs speak Arabic as their native language
The Arab merchant traded spices along the silk road

definitions: individual form of life such as plant, animal, or microbe
examples: Every organism needs water to survive and grow
Scientists discovered a new organism in the deep ocean

definitions: art of making three-dimensional forms by carving or molding materials
examples: The marble sculpture stood majestically in the plaza
Modern sculpture often uses unconventional materials

definitions: relating to the sea or organisms living in it
soldier serving in a naval infantry force
examples: Marine biologists study life in the ocean
The marine ecosystem faces threats from pollution
The marine completed basic training at Parris Island
Marines are known for their discipline and courage

definitions: aggressive pressure or intimidation directed at a person repeatedly
examples: The company has strict policies against workplace harassment
Online harassment has become a serious social problem

definitions: musical instrument played by striking a membrane stretched over a frame
large cylindrical container for storing liquids or other materials
examples: He played the drum in the school band
The drummer kept perfect time throughout the song
Store the oil in a fifty-five gallon drum
Empty drums can be recycled at the facility

definitions: hard protective covering worn to protect the head from injury
examples: Always wear a helmet when riding your bicycle
The construction worker's helmet saved him from injury

definitions: official document that proves something is true or has been completed
examples: She proudly displayed her teaching certificate on the wall
The certificate proves completion of the training course

definitions: small vehicle with wheels used for carrying goods or people
examples: Push the shopping cart through the grocery store aisles
The vendor pulled his cart full of fresh vegetables
